page.title: 01BOWERSHALL
page.content: AREA :03080690 LANDSCAPE Bowershall is a hamlet lying 5 km north of Dunfermline in West Fife. The land is mainly hilly ranging from 150 metres at Meldrums Mill burn to 249 metres at Roscobie Hill. There are several small burns. The land is used mainly for hill sheep farming and cattle rearing with cultivated grass covering the largest percentage of the land. Crops such as barley, hay and silage are also grown. Throughout the area there are many indications that coal mining and quarrying such as Redcraigs Quarry were important in the past but none is carried out now.
